page.title: 14ECOLOGY 1
page.content: Footpaths & bridleways are widespread & well used, much clearing & mainten- ance having been recently undertaken by the Chiltern Society & the Whelpley Hill Riding Club. Farmers with paths over their land are mostly cooperative, with some exceptions. There is an old cattle pond notable for yellow flags on the Green at Ashl- ey Green, & a deeper pond with water plantains in the centre of Whelpley Hill.At 600ft, the climate is fairly severe in winter with more snow than Aylesbury Vale.In the winter two dist- inct fog patterns are experienced- hi- ls under cloud base & the valleys cle- ar,or the high ground sunny with dense fog in the nearby valley towns.Rainf- all is about 25ins a year.With no con- nurbations, the air is reasonably unp- olluted as shown by lichen & fungus growth.
